author: iSazonov
body:
Resolve #4220.

The cmdlet is based on [Newtonsoft.Json.Schema](https://github.com/JamesNK/Newtonsoft.Json.Schema).
It allow to check:
- Json by only parsing
- Json against Schema
- implicitly check Schema by parsing (based on previous line check)

Please see [license](https://github.com/JamesNK/Newtonsoft.Json.Schema/blob/master/LICENSE.md) of the framework (GNU Affero General Public License). /cc @joeyaiello @SteveL-MSFT

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I’ll check if we can accept this license.  For now, you’ll need to add it to https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/ThirdPartyNotices.txt as part of this PR

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT I can not pull changes in ThirdPartyNotices.txt - it is excluded file.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov ok, I'll take care of that file then once I get approval.  We should not merge this PR until the license is approved for this project.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: To set expectation, since this depends on a component that has a non-permissive license, it may take some time to get this approved.  Also, since the [Ignite](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/ignite/default.aspx) conference is this week, many of the approvers are not here.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Could you ping license approvers? Also can we ask the author of the package to change/add MIT license?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov since it appears that [Json.Net Schema](https://www.newtonsoft.com/jsonschema) is how NewtonSoft makes money, I doubt they will change the license.  Still waiting on the approval, but to be honest with a non-permissive license, this will likely not be approved as I don't think it's compatible with the MIT license.  Your best option might be to publish this as a separate module on the PowerShellGallery as long as it adheres to the AGPL.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Thanks. I hope that if they offer AGPL for open source projects, they don't lose anything with adding MIT.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov so after talking to legal, the end result is that if we accept this PR (which will pull in the AGPL assembly and we distribute that package) then we would have to re-license PSCore6 under the AGPL to comply with the AGPL.  I think the alternate path is for you to publish this code under AGPL in your own repo and publish the resulting module on PowerShellGallery and then there is no issue with someone using a AGPL module with our MIT PSCore6.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT I've made a request to obtain a suitable license.
If the answer will be no, I guess we have to find another way, because Json is very desirable to have inside.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Because of the licensing problem, I closed the PR and I'll open a new PR with another library.
